items.title: Oxford Internet Institute
items.subtitle: Rhodes Scholar; MSc Social Science of the Internet
items.text: Pursuing a Masters focusing on online journalism, funded by the Rhodes Trust. My thesis research looks at email newsletters as a source of news, exploring how they change the relationship between writers and audiences.

items.title: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
items.subtitle: B.A. Journalism (honors); Computer Science
items.text: Graduated with Highest Distinction, double-majoring in journalism and computer science with a minor in entrepreneurship. Relevant coursework includes Software Architecture, Interactive Journalism, Big Data Ethics, UX design, Multimedia Storytelling and Emerging Technologies.

items.title: Duke University
items.subtitle: Robertson Scholar
items.text: Member of a selective scholarship program as a “dual citizen” of both UNC and Duke, studying and living at both schools. Coursework: Algorithmic Journalism, Politics and Media, Fact-Checking and Profile Writing.

items.title: Thomas Jefferson High School for Science and Technology
items.subtitle: Software Engineering
items.text: Attended a selective STEM high school, graduating with a concentration in software engineering.

items.title: The Washington Post
items.subtitle: Newsroom Engineer, Elections
items.text: Helped build the Post's elections infrastructure for the 2020 presidential race, including UX design, data visualization, and frontend development; along with work on data pipelines for the Post's COVID trackers.

items.title: The Wall Street Journal
items.subtitle: Graphics Intern
items.text: Scraped and analyzed data, built interactives and designed graphics for The Journal's Business & Finance section in both print and online, including graphics for front-page stories on both platforms.

items.title: The Guardian
items.subtitle: Visuals Intern
items.text: Covered the 2018 midterm elections for the Guardian, building parts of the election backend and results page. Later produced post-election analyses and visual stories, then freelanced for the paper in 2019-20.

items.title: NBC
items.subtitle: Multimedia Journalism Intern
items.text: Produced videos, graphics and interactives for NBC’s national newsroom, creating reusable digital tools and new reader experiences across 15 owned-and-operated local websites.

items.title: The Delta Center
items.subtitle: Media Intern
items.text: Helped run the Delta Center’s “Most Southern Place on Earth” teacher-training workshops by coordinating logistics, taking photos and video, producing multimedia stories and designing printed marketing.

items.title: CustomInk
items.subtitle: Software Engineering Intern, eCommerce
items.text: Entirely rebuilt the internal inventory management website, improving load times and reliability of the system using MySQL, MongoDB, Ruby on Rails and Javascript.

items.title: nvite
items.subtitle: Software Engineering Intern
items.text: Architected, built and launched a new “communities” feature for the start-up events platform, a key part of their eventual acquisition by Eventbrite in 2017.

items.title: 2020 Elections: Live Results
items.subtitle: Data, Interactive
items.text: On the Washington Post's Elections Engineering team, I worked to ensure the functionality and effective storytelling on our 2020 election results pages, contributing to the entire stack from scraping and data processing all the way to visualization.

items.title: 2020 Elections: Tracking the Early Vote
items.subtitle: Data, Engineering
items.text: Built a system to aggregate early voting and turnout data from all 50 states, then used it to analyze and visualize results for this live tracker that ran for a month ahead of the 2020 election.

items.title: Teachers for Bernie, Retirees for Trump: Who's backing whom in 2020
items.subtitle: Data, Interactive
items.text: Built a database to help Guardian reporters analyze the campaign finance filings from presidential hopefuls, then used that data to write multiple stories about donor demographics.

items.title: Gun violence has sharply declined in the's Bay Area. What happened?
items.subtitle: Interactive
items.text: Led design, development and data visualization for the first story in The Guardian's series about gun violence in the San Francisco Bay Area.

items.title: 2018 US Midterms: Live Results
items.subtitle: Interactive, Data
items.text: Designed and built portions of The Guardian's elections stack, including backend data parsing, a staging environment, front-end React components, the ticker and post-election graphics analyzing results.

items.title: Facebook, the New Frontier of Political Ads
items.subtitle: Writing, Interactive
items.text: An investigative story and interactive about the habits of political advertisers on Facebook, using scraped data even before the release of the company's Ad Archive API.

items.title: "Things Have Got to Change": Affordable Housing in Chapel Hill
items.subtitle: Writing
items.text: A profile of Yvette Matthews, an activist for affordable housing amid soaring rents in Chapel Hill.

items.title: Visualizing Data Beyond Flatland
items.subtitle: Digital Journalism, UX/UI
items.text: My undergraduate honors thesis studied the user experience of augmented reality journalism, designing my own AR graphics and conducting user tests to create guidelines for future designs.

items.title: Duke DeWitt Wallace Center for Media and Democracy
items.subtitle: Online Gatekeeping, Local News
items.text: I worked with Dr. Phillip Napoli to study the audience for local news on Facebook, using computational methods and exclusive datasets. Published in Nieman Lab and the Association of Internet Researchers, and recieved the center's award for Outstanding Journalism Research.

items.title: Reese Innovation Lab
items.subtitle: AR Storytelling
items.text: I developed new storytelling technologies in Prof. Steven King's lab, including a photogrammetry tool, AR experiences and a prototype of scavenger hunt app which won a $75,000 grant. Responsibilities included product management, research, design and development.
